bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, May 24, 1948

div1.p: Kean relates the incident in which Carroll broke quarantine and ruined the validity of the experiment. Reed told Kean that he was quite irritated with Carroll's actions.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, May 24, 1948
div1.opener:
2804 N STREET N. W.
WASHINGTON 7, D. C.
24 May '48
My dear Colonel Hench
div1.p:
However busy you are, you
never fail to think of your friends.
I was delighted to get the pamphlet
printed for the Hall of Fame installa-
of the bust of Walter Reed. But
for your collection of documents and
your interest it could never have
been made. I was glad to have
this recognized on page 3. The use
of Reed's letters is most effec-
tive and his clear hand writing
makes them easy to read. The
bust and the picture of him aboard
ship are both good likenesses.
I was interested to read W.Rs letter to
me and about Carroll's illness (on page 5)
2
in which Carroll's breaking quarantine
by going into Havana and to an au-
topsy the day after he was bitten by a
mosquito, thus vitiating the value of the
experiment. He was too worried about
Carroll's illness to show the irritation
over Carrolls act which he afterwards
showed in speaking to me of it.

I was pleased to see that you located
the statements of Prof Welch and Gen.
Wood. Nothing escapes you. Also the
quotation from Gorgas's letter to Reed on
page 18 in which Gorgas stated fairly
his relation to Reed's work and is a
perfect answer to the claim that Hendrick
advances that Reed experiments were just
laboratory work which Reed did not know
how to apply practically, until Gorgas
developed it. Reeds letter to Howard p.16
shows that he knew perfectly how to fight mosquitoes
3
It is an admirable libretto and of
course I am delighted that your
selections have made me shine in
the reflection of Reed's glory more than
I deserve. With cordial regards
to Mrs. Hench in which Mrs Kean
joins

closer.salute:
I am always
affectionately your friend
